metadata.title: CVE-2019-8324 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in RubyGems 2.6 and later through 3.0.2. A crafted gem with a multi-line name is not handled correctly. Therefore, an attacker could inject arbitrary code to the stub line of gemspec, which is eval-ed by code in ensure_loadable_spec during the preinstall check. It was discovered that RubyGems as embedded in JRuby did not properly handle multi-line gem names. If a user were tricked into installing a malicious gem, an attacker could execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-8324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 9.1.17.0-3
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> ruby{1.9.1,2.0,2.3} and jruby ship an embedded rubygems.

criterions.comment: jruby package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.17.0-3').
